body_html: @gokul-uf - Nope, this is not being actively developed at this time. Not quite sure if using eager helps you either. You could easily convert a Tensor to numpy and use advanced indexing, but if you want to compute gradients through that indexing, that won't work.

body: @gokul-uf - Nope, this is not being actively developed at this time. Not quite sure if using eager helps you either. You could easily convert a Tensor to numpy and use advanced indexing, but if you want to compute gradients through that indexing, that won't work.
